title: What does it mean that TreVeyon Henderson is listed 3rd on the Patriots’ depth chart?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Rookie TreVeyon Henderson is listed as third running back on the Patriots' depth chart, behind Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson.
Henderson impressed in preseason with a 100-yard kick return and an eight-yard rushing touchdown against the Vikings.
Head coach Mike Vrabel continues to use a committee approach, with Stevenson, Gibson, and Henderson expected to share running back duties.

title: Here’s what fantasy football experts are saying about Patriots players in Week 1
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots rookie TreVeyon Henderson's fantasy value is uncertain despite preseason buzz, with a committee approach expected in the backfield.
Drake Maye is considered a fantasy 'sleeper' for Week 1 against the Raiders, who struggled with pass defense last season.
Despite a successful rehab from a torn ACL, Stefon Diggs is set to play without restrictions, providing stability for quarterback Drake Maye.

title: Hundred-year book debate: Which 1926 classic still stands the test of time?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The Boston Public Library hosts an annual debate on books published a century ago, focusing on 1926 this year.
Eight 1926 titles, including Hemingway's 'The Sun Also Rises' and Milne's 'Winnie-the-Pooh', are being considered.
Readers can vote on their favorite 1926 book until September 27, with a live debate set for February 10, 2026.

title: As Fernandes Anderson’s sentencing looms, read what Boston city councilors wrote in letters to judge
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson awaits sentencing on federal wire fraud and theft charges.
Councilor Brian Worrell and others wrote letters vouching for Fernandes Anderson's character and advocating leniency.
Letters highlighted Fernandes Anderson's community contributions and urged at-home confinement over prison time.

title: Two-thirds of BPS school buses were on time on day 1. Here’s how that compares to last year.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston Public Schools reported a 66% on-time rate for buses on the first day of school, the highest on record.
85% of school buses arrived within 15 minutes of the bell, and 94% within 30 minutes, according to BPS officials.
Last year, the first day on-time rate was only 34%, amid the rollout of a new bus-tracking app.

title: Look inside Back Bay’s Sheraton Boston after a $100 million renovation
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston completed a $100 million renovation, updating its lobby, guest rooms, dining, and meeting spaces.
The hotel's revamped features include a retractable roof pool deck, 24-hour fitness studio, and event spaces.
Starting rates at the renovated Sheraton Boston range from $300 to $400, offering new dining and lodging options.

title: Insider predicts how Alex Bregman, Trevor Story will handle player options with Red Sox this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Bregman is likely to opt out of his Red Sox contract, seeking a longer deal in free agency.
Trevor Story is expected to opt in, remaining with the Red Sox for the final two years of his contract.
Yankees, Phillies, and Tigers are potential suitors for Bregman, who performed strongly this season with a .281 batting average.

title: Roman Anthony played a big role getting the Red Sox into playoff position. It’s on the veterans to play into October.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Roman Anthony strained his left oblique and will miss 4-6 weeks, impacting Red Sox's playoff push.
The Red Sox overcame a slow start to position themselves in the playoff race, now with a 98.1% postseason chance.
Veterans like Trevor Story and Alex Bregman must step up with Anthony injured for continued success into October.

title: Review: ‘The Paper’ shows promise, even as ‘The Office’ legacy looms large
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Paper' is a new Peacock comedy series and 'The Office' spinoff, featuring a return of Oscar Nuñez's character.
The series is set in a small-town newspaper struggling under corporate pressures, echoing themes from 'The Office'.
'The Paper' has been renewed for a second season, showing potential despite strong influences from its predecessor.

title: Randy Moss opened up about cancer battle, support he received, and helping Deion Sanders
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Randy Moss was diagnosed with Stage 2 bile-duct cancer in late 2024, but is now in remission and returning to ESPN.
Moss underwent a six-hour surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation as part of his cancer treatment.
During his cancer battle, Moss supported former competitor Deion Sanders through his own health struggles.
